title: Digital Onboarding & Account Management

sections.title: Modern Account Types & Onboarding
sections.content:
Today, opening an account is often done via a mobile app. This is called **Digital Onboarding**.

- **Neobank**: A digital-only bank without physical branches.
- **Mobile-first**: Designed primarily for mobile apps.
- **Digital ID verification**: Using your camera to scan documents.
- **Selfie verification**: Taking a photo of yourself for security.
- **E-statement**: An electronic version of your bank statement.
- **Push notification**: An alert sent to your phone for transactions.
- **Minimum balance**: The lowest amount of money required to avoid fees.

sections.title: Digital Onboarding Process
sections.content:
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Download App] --> B[Verify Email/Phone]
    B --> C[Scan ID Document]
    C --> D[Take Video/Selfie]
    D --> E[Wait for Approval]
    E --> F[Digital Card Issued]
    F --> G[Initial Deposit]
```

sections.title: Past Simple: Recording Recent Actions
sections.content:
We use the **Past Simple** to talk about completed actions in the past. For regular verbs, we add **-ed**.

**Common Digital Banking Verbs:**
- **Scan** -> Scanned: *I scanned my ID yesterday.*
- **Download** -> Downloaded: *She downloaded the app last night.*
- **Log in** -> Logged in: *He logged in to check his balance.*
- **Transfer** -> Transferred: *They transferred the funds this morning.*
- **Approve** -> Approved: *The bank approved my account in 5 minutes.*

caseStudies.title: Scenario: The New Digital Customer
caseStudies.scenario: A new customer, Sarah, wants to open a business account with your neobank. She is unfamiliar with the process and needs guidance on how to complete the 'Selfie Verification' and 'Digital ID' steps.
objectives: Explain the digital onboarding steps clearly
Reassure the customer about security measures
Guide her on how to use her smartphone camera for verification

questions.question: Sarah asks: 'Why do I need to take a selfie?' What is the best response?
options: It is for our social media page.
It is a security measure to verify that the person opening the account is the same as on the ID.
We just want to see if you look good.
It is optional, you can skip it.
questions.explanation: Selfie verification is a biometric security step used in digital onboarding.

questions.question: To complete the process, Sarah needs to ________ her ID document using the app's camera.
questions.explanation: Scanning the ID is a required step for digital verification.

objectives: Understand the digital onboarding process in neobanks
Identify key terms for mobile banking security
Describe past banking actions using regular verbs in Past Simple
